metadata.title: CVE-2021-21704 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In PHP versions 7.3.x below 7.3.29, 7.4.x below 7.4.21 and 8.0.x below8.0.8, when using Firebird PDO driver extension, a malicious databaseserver could cause crashes in various database functions, such asgetAttribute(), execute(), fetch() and others by returning invalid responsedata that is not parsed correctly by the driver. This can result incrashes, denial of service or potentially memory corruption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21704` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-common - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-curl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-enchant - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-fpm - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-gd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-gmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-intl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-ldap - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-mysql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-mysqlnd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-readline - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-recode - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-snmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-sqlite - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-sybase - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-tidy - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-xmlrpc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
php5-xsl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm14').
